update.description: The SemanticPose class provides a consistent way to resolve poses of DOM objects. The class has a private constructor that can be called by specific DOM classes, such as Link in this pull request. It has a weak pointer to the graphs stored by the Model or World and is meant to have a short lifetime. Implementations for other classes will follow; I included on the `Link` implementation here to make it more concise and easier to follow.
update.title: [Citadel] Add SemanticPose class with implementation for Link.

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Add SemanticPose class with implementation for Link.

content.raw: Okay, I can see how this can happen for DOM objects like `sdf::Sensor`. My thought is that we should handle an empty `defaultResolveTo` as we handle a non-existent `poseRelativeToGraph`, which is to return an error when `Resolve` is called instead of asserting here. That way the `SemanticPose` object can still be used to get the raw pose for objects that don't come from a `Model::Load`.
content.html: Okay, I can see how this can happen for DOM objects like sdf::Sensor. My thought is that we should handle an empty defaultResolveTo as we handle a non-existent poseRelativeToGraph, which is to return an error when Resolve is called instead of asserting here. That way the SemanticPose object can still be used to get the raw pose for objects that don't come from a Model::Load.

pull_request.title: [Citadel] Add SemanticPose class with implementation for Link.

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Add SemanticPose class with implementation for Link.

content.raw: @{557057:f3a199b9-5784-4964-9644-6ef224bc7dc1} saw some LSan errors in their CI because this class doesn't have a destructor. This class needs the rule of five. Since this is a new class, I would vote for using `unique_ptr`. Some classes such as `sdf::Element` and `sdf::Filesystem`  already use it, so it wouldn't be a new thing.
content.html: @Eric Cousineau saw some LSan errors in their CI because this class doesn't have a destructor. This class needs the rule of five. Since this is a new class, I would vote for using unique_ptr. Some classes such as sdf::Element and sdf::Filesystem already use it, so it wouldn't be a new thing.

pull_request.title: [Citadel] Add SemanticPose class with implementation for Link.

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Add SemanticPose class with implementation for Link.

content.raw:
An ASSERT in a constructor seems a bit aggressive. You could throw an error, and then the caller would be able to catch the problem. However, I don't like to use `throw` as a means to pass information.

I'm not entirely sure what the intent is, but you could add a `SemanticPose::Valid` function.
content.html:
An ASSERT in a constructor seems a bit aggressive. You could throw an error, and then the caller would be able to catch the problem. However, I don't like to use throw as a means to pass information.

I'm not entirely sure what the intent is, but you could add a SemanticPose::Valid function.

content.raw: I was able to reproduce it by calling `SemanticPose()` in one of the objects created in a unit test like `UNIT_Frame_TEST` or `UNIT_Link_TEST`, since they don't come from a Model::Load call
content.html: I was able to reproduce it by calling SemanticPose() in one of the objects created in a unit test like UNIT_Frame_TEST or UNIT_Link_TEST, since they don't come from a Model::Load call

content.raw:
with this approach, the SemanticPose is correct, though its RawPose doesn't match the Link's RawPose, because that is encoded already in the graph

instead of passing a `Pose3d::Zero`, I had thought about using a `std::optional<Pose3d>` and only post-multiply if a pose is supplied, but I didn't get around to it
content.html:
with this approach, the SemanticPose is correct, though its RawPose doesn't match the Link's RawPose, because that is encoded already in the graph

instead of passing a Pose3d::Zero, I had thought about using a std::optional<Pose3d> and only post-multiply if a pose is supplied, but I didn't get around to it

pull_request.title: [Citadel] Add SemanticPose class with implementation for Link.

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Add SemanticPose class with implementation for Link.

content.raw: I'm passing `Pose3d::Zero` with the name of the link, because it has zero pose offset from itself. this comes from merging the pose resolution logic for links, joints, and frames, which are vertices in the graph, with collisions, visuals, etc. that aren't in the graph, and by necessity need to offset from a named frame
content.html: I'm passing Pose3d::Zero with the name of the link, because it has zero pose offset from itself. this comes from merging the pose resolution logic for links, joints, and frames, which are vertices in the graph, with collisions, visuals, etc. that aren't in the graph, and by necessity need to offset from a named frame
